contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|van}} {{TOCright}} A '''[[van]]''' is a road vehicle used for transporting goods or groups of people. '''Van''' may also refer to: ==Abbreviations== * [[Value-added network]], as used in Electronic Data Interchange * Van Speelautomaten Branche-Organisatie, the Dutch branch of [[EUROMAT]] * [[Vehicle Area Network]], an electronic communications network that interconnects components inside vehicles * [[VAN method]], an experimental earthquake prediction method * The country code for [[Vanuatu]] * [[Vancomycin]], an antibiotic * [[Vancouver]], a city in British Columbia, Canada. * [[Voluntary Arts Network]], the UK and Republic of Ireland development agency for the voluntary arts and crafts *[[Vanguard (military tactics)|Vanguard]], the forward element of an advancing military tactical formation ==People== {{Hatnote|This is list of people with the given name Van. For those with Van as part of their surname, see [[Van (Dutch)]]}} ===Surname=== *[[Jessika Van]], American actress *[[Lindsey Van]] (born 1984), American ski jumper *[[Marina de Van]] (born 1971), French film director, screenwriter and actress *[[Tomiko Van]] (born 1971), Japanese singer and actress ===Given name=== * [[Van Cliburn]], a pianist * [[Van Hansis]], an actor * [[Van Heflin]], an actor * [[Van Johnson]], an actor * [[Van Jones]], former Green Jobs Advisor to the Obama administration * [[Van Morrison]] (born 1945), an Irish musician * [[Van Nelson]] (born 1945), an American long-distance runner * [[Van Tiffin]], former Alabama Crimson Tide placekicker ===Fictional characters=== * [[Van (Chrono Cross)|Van (''Chrono Cross'')]], from the PlayStation game ''Chrono Cross'' * [[Van (Gun X Sword)|Van (''Gun X Sword'')]], the main character of the anime ''Gun X Sword'' * [[Van Fanel]], from the anime ''The Vision of Escaflowne'' * [[Van Flyheight]], from the anime ''Zoids'' * [[Van Hohenheim]], from the manga series ''Fullmetal Alchemist'' and the anime ''Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood'' (referred to as "Hohenheim of Light" in the initial Fullmetal Alchemist anime series) * [[Van Montgomery]], from the TV series ''Reba'' * [[Van Wilder]], the protagonist of the film ''National Lampoon's Van Wilder'' * Van, a [[List of Cars characters#Van and Minny|character in the Pixar film ''Cars'']] * Van Grants, from the PlayStation 2 game ''[[Tales of the Abyss]]'' * Van Veen, the main character of Vladimir Nabokov's ''[[Ada or Ardor]]'' ==Places== ===Turkey=== *[[Van, Turkey]] * [[Van Province]] * [[Sanjak of Van]] in [[Van Province]] * [[Lake Van]] ===United Kingdom=== * [[Van, Caerphilly]] * [[Van, Llanidloes]] ===United States=== * [[Van, Texas]] * [[Van, West Virginia]] * [[Van, Arkansas]] * [[Van, Kentucky]] * [[Van, Michigan]] * [[Van, Missouri]] * [[Van, Ohio]] * [[Van, Oregon]] * [[Van, Pennsylvania]] * [[Van, Utah]] * [[Van, Virginia]] ==Railway Vehicles== * [[Goods van]], an enclosed, railway, freight wagon * [[Brake van]] (or guard's van), a railway vehicle used for crew accommodation and administration in a goods train * [[Boxcar]] * [[Caboose]] * [[Railroad car]] ==Other uses== * [[Van (Dutch)|Van]], a Dutch preposition meaning "of" or "from the place of" * [[Van (band)]], a Swedish musical group active in the late 1990s * ''[[Los Van Van]]'', a Cuban musical group * [[Turkish Van]], a breed of cat * [[Van Halen]], A rock band * ''Van'' or ''[[Vana (disambiguation)|Vana]]'', meaning forest in Sanskrit, Hindi and many Indian languages, giving rise to terms like Vana Parva (the Episode of Forest) in the epic ''Ramayana'' ==See also== * [[Vans (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation|geo|given name|surname}}
